intro: Lesquerella praecox, commonly known as the early lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has hairy, glandular leaves that are characteristic of the genus Lesquerella. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert environments. The seeds of Lesquerella praecox contain a unique oil used in industrial applications, making it economically significant.
